1.text: I cut out a covenant for mine eyes; and why shall I show myself attentive to a virgin?

2.text: And what the portion of God from above? and the inheritance of the Almighty from the heights?

3.text: Is not destruction to the evil one? and strangeness to those working iniquity?

4.text: Will he not see my way, and number all my steps?

5.text: If I went with vanity, and my foot will haste upon deceit;

6.text: He shall weigh me in balances of justice, and God will know mine integrity.

7.text: If my going will incline from the way, and my heart went after mine eyes, and a blemish did cleave upon my hands:

8.text: I will sow and another shall eat; and my offspring shall be rooted up.

9.text: If my heart was seduced by woman, and I laid wait at the door of my neighbor;

10.text: My wife shall grind for another, and others shall bow down upon her.

11.text: For this is crime, and this is iniquity for the judges.

12.text: For it is a fire; it will devour even to destruction, and will root out upon all mine increase.

13.text: If I shall despise the judgment of my servant and my maid in their contending with me;

14.text: And what shall I do when God shall rise up? And when he shall review, what shall I turn back to him?

15.text: Did not he making me in the womb, make him? And he will prepare us in one belly.

16.text: If I shall withhold from the desire of the poor, and cause the eyes of the widow to fail;

17.text: And eating my morsel alone, and the orphan ate not from it;

18.text: (For from my youth he grew up to me as a father, and I shall guide her from my motherâ€™s womb;)

19.text: If I shall see one perishing from not being clothed, and no covering to the needy;

20.text: If his loins did not praise me, and he will be warmed from the fleece of my sheep.

21.text: If I lifted up my hand against the orphan when I shall see, my help in the gate:

22.text: My shoulder shall fall from its shoulder-blade, and mine, arm shall be broken from the bone.

23.text: For the destruction of God is a terror to me, and from his lifting up I shall not prevail.

24.text: If I set gold my hope, and said to gold, My trust;

25.text: If I shall rejoice because of the Multitude of my riches, and because my hand found much;

26.text: If I shall see the light when it shall shine, and the moon going in splendor;

27.text: And my heart will be seduced in secret, and my hand shall kiss to my mouth:

28.text: Also this an iniquity for the judges: for I lied to God from above.

29.text: If I shall rejoice in the destruction of him hating me, and I exalted when evil found him:

30.text: And I gave not my palate to sin to ask in cursing his soul.

31.text: If the men of my tent said not, Who will give from his flesh? We shall not be satisfied.

32.text: The stranger shall not lodge without: I shall open my doors to the traveler.

33.text: If I covered my transgression, as man, to hide mine iniquity in my bosom:

34.text: If I, shall fear a great multitude, and the contempt of families terrify me, and I will be silent and not go out of my door.

35.text: Who will give to me hearing to me? Behold, my sign, the Almighty will answer me, and the man contending with me wrote a book.

36.text: If not, I shall lift it up upon my shoulder, I will bind it a crown to me.

37.text: The number of my steps I shall announce to him: as a leader I shall draw near to him.

38.text: If my land shall cry against me, and its, furrows shall weep together;

39.text: If I ate its strength without silver, and caused its possessors to expire:

40.text: The thorn shall come forth, instead of wheat, and the weed instead of barley. The words of Job were completed.
